etymologies: late 16th century: from tway (variant of twain) + blade, translating Latin bifolium

definitions: an orchid with a slender spike of greenish or mauve flowers and a single pair of broad leaves near the base or midway up the stem.

notes.text: Genera Listera and Liparis, family Orchidaceae: several species, including the North American heartleaf twayblade (Listera cordata) and the Eurasian common twayblade (Listera ovata)

shortDefinitions: orchid with slender spike of greenish or brownish flowers
